function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"High Rt leading to uncontrolled epidemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strong assumption of intervention efficacy across different countries","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Higher proportion of the population infected in spain 15.0%","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large changes in rt in response to non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in reproduction numbers rt across countries","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to conclude whether interventions are sufficient to drive rt below 1","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High level of under-ascertainment of infections due to focus on testing in hospital settings rather than in the community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low percentage of individuals infected, with an attack rate on average of 4.9%","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimates imply that the populations in europe are not close to herd immunity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of specific parameter choices , serial interval distribution, infection fatality ratio on the estimated number of true underlying cases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimation of changes in transmission risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of nonparametric function with a gaussian process prior distribution","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nationwide school
